block.p: Virginia Nash Seabring, a daughter of Ellen and Robert Seabring of Bronxville, N.Y., was married yesterday to Henry Miller Watts III, a son of the late Barbara and William Watts, who lived in Ardmore, Pa. The Rev. Dr. William Steele performed the ceremony at the Reformed Church of Bronxville.

The bride, 28, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an accounts manager in San Francisco for the communications networks division of Siemens, the German electronics conglomerate. She graduated from Colgate University. Her mother is the executive director of the Bronxville School Foundation. Her father is the vice president in charge of institutional money management at Citigroup in New York.

Virginia Nash Seabring, a daughter of Ellen and Robert Seabring of Bronxville, N.Y., was married yesterday to Henry Miller Watts III, a son of the late Barbara and William Watts, who lived in Ardmore, Pa. The Rev. Dr. William Steele performed the ceremony at the Reformed Church of Bronxville.

The bride, 28, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an accounts manager in San Francisco for the communications networks division of Siemens, the German electronics conglomerate. She graduated from Colgate University. Her mother is the executive director of the Bronxville School Foundation. Her father is the vice president in charge of institutional money management at Citigroup in New York.

The bridegroom, 31, is a service manager in San Francisco for Cisco Systems, the Internet equipment manufacturer. He graduated from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor. His father was a circulation coordinator for The Philadelphia Bulletin, the former newspaper.
